DataElement.preferredName: Submitted Tumor Sample Anatomic Site Location Description Other Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe another anatomic site location description for the submitted tumor sample that is not already specified or mentioned.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Submitted Tumor Sample Anatomic Site Subsite and/or Spatial Qualifier Description
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Named locations of or within the body._A position within another named site._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A term used to indicate an object's position in space or it's relationship in space to another object._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredName: Anatomic Site Subsite And/Or Spatial Qualifier Description

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.
A position within another named site.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A term used to indicate an object's position in space or it's relationship in space to another object.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.
